content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining Operation at (-15, -15)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (24.0, -15.0)
- Wooden chest at (23.5, -16.5) storing coal (217 units)

### Iron Mining Operation at (-14, 23)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (-14.0, 23.0)
- Wooden chest at (-14.5, 21.5) storing iron ore (789 units)

### Copper Processing Line 1 at (20, 20)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (20.0, 20.0)
- Wooden chest at (20.5, 21.5) storing copper ore (140 units)

### Copper Processing Line 2 at (24, 20)
Consists of:
- Stone furnace at (24.0, 20.0)
- Input wooden chest at (22.5, 21.5) storing copper ore (401 units)
- Output wooden chest at (24.5, 17.5) storing copper plates (53 units)
- Burner inserter at (24.5, 18.5) moving items from furnace to output chest
- Burner inserter at (22.5, 20.5) moving items from input chest to furnace

### Unused Furnaces at (-10, 20)
Two stone furnaces at:
- (-11.0, 20.0)
- (-9.0, 20.0)

ERROR TIPS

### Furnace Operation Issues
- Ensure furnaces have both fuel and ingredients to operate. Multiple furnaces are showing NO_INGREDIENTS status
- Monitor fuel levels in burner mining drills to prevent work interruption
- Check if inserters are properly oriented and positioned to effectively move materials between chests and furnaces

### Entity Placement and Configuration
- Verify inserter pickup and drop positions align with source and destination entities
- When placing inserters, ensure proper orientation immediately to avoid need for later rotation
- Consider the complete production line layout before placing entities to minimize need for adjustments

### Resource Management
- Monitor coal distribution across burner entities to maintain continuous operation
- Ensure proper material flow between connected entities in production lines
